FuncDef: The display l2tp tunnel rui command displays L2TP tunnel backup information.
CLIs: display l2tp tunnel rui [ tunnel-item <tunnel-item> | tunnel-name <remote-name> | bas-interface { <if-name> | <if-type> <if-number> } | remote-backup-profile <rbp-name> | remote-backup-service <rbs-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about an L2TP tunnel with a specified ID.
The value of the local ID for an L2TP tunnel ranges from 1 to 65535.

Displays L2TP information with a specific remote name.
-

Displays information about a tunnel that is set up using information about a user accessing a specified interface.
-

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Displays information about an L2TP tunnel associated with a specified RBP.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 characters.

Displays information about an L2TP tunnel associated with a specified RBS.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: LTID: local assigned tunnel ID, RTID:Remote assigned tunnel ID, RA:Remote Ip address, RN: Remote Name, RG: Register(L:local,R:remote)
LTID  RTID  RA              RN                Sessions RG state    Life(s)
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display l2tp tunnel rui command is used to display L2TP tunnel backup information, including backup parameters in brief or details in the L2TP dual-system hot backup scenario. Dual-system hot backup parameters of L2TP tunnels that are not backed up will not be displayed.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
